title: Victoria Beckham praises 'soulmate' David Beckham on The View
text:
She tied the knot with her husband David Beckham 20 years ago.

And Victoria Beckham appeared to be just as loved-up as ever as she gushed over how 'lucky' she is to have the former footballer as her 'soulmate' on Friday.

During a chat on The View, the fashion designer, 45, discussed her marriage to David who she described as a 'wonderful' husband and joked about their sex life.

Solid: Victoria Beckham appeared to be just as loved-up as ever as she gushed over how 'lucky' she is to have the former footballer as her 'soulmate' on Friday

When asked how long they had been together by the show's host Joy Behar, Victoria, who celebrated her wedding anniversary in July, said: '20 years can you believe it!'

Referencing David's obvious good looks which have previously won him the Sexiest Man Alive award, Joy jokingly asked: 'So, what attracted you to him?'

Victoria sweetly replied: 'You know obviously he's incredibly good looking but David is the most wonderful husband and fantastic father and a real inspiration to all of us, he's hard working. I'm lucky to have him as my soul mate.'

Asking Victoria about the foundations of their relationship, Joy said: 'You have to be friends with somebody after many years together, because the sex, eh...'

However poking fun at their sex life, Victoria retorted: 'Don't worry about that!'

The Beckhams famously married in a spectacular ceremony, costing a reported £800,000 in which they both donned bold ensembles. Images from the big day featured in an OK! spread and front cover story.

Their marriage came when David had just won the treble with Manchester United and Victoria was a global icon with the Spice Girls.

Their highly-anticipated wedding ceremony took place on July 4 in an extravagant ceremony — complete with golden thrones and a glittering tiara for the blushing bride.

Joker: Referencing David's obvious good looks which have previously won his him the Sexiest Man Alive award, Joy then jokingly asked: 'So, what attracted you to him?'

While no expense was spared for the nuptials — conducted by Bishop of Cork, Paul Colton — the day was also filled with touching, heartfelt moments, including then four-month-old son Brooklyn serving as the ring bearer.

In 2017, Victoria wrote a letter to her 18-year-old self back for Vogue last year, offering marriage tips. She wrote: 'In marriage: have patience. Bite your tongue. Be supportive. And preserve a bit of mystique.

'Never let yourself go completely (at least brush your hair, clean your teeth, have a bit of a brow going on because you will always want him to look at you and feel attracted).'

Victoria sweetly replied: 'You know obviously he's incredibly good looking but David is the most wonderful husband and fantastic father and a real inspiration to all of us, he's hard working. I'm lucky to have him as my soul mate'

Playful: 'Asking Victoria about the foundations of their relationship, Joy said: 'You have to be friends with somebody after many years together, because the sex, eh...'

In 2010, David spoke to Hello! about how they keep their relationship alive, with David saying they 'have a date night every Wednesday.'

Victoria added: 'We catch up on what we’ve missed on TV. We watch Keeping Up With The Kardashians. We’re soulmates. Sometimes people throw s*** at us but we get through it...

'You deal with it, or you don’t.'You go into a marriage knowing there are going to be ups and downs. We’re in the public eye so we have more to deal with than most. We accepted that years ago. It’s just about us and the family.'

Victoria and David share four children together, Brooklyn, 20, Romeo, 17, Cruz, 14 and Harper, eight.
